comments.commentBody: Wait! Our fate is in the hands of a man who just told the people of the USA that President Obama tried to have communications to and from Trump Tower tapped legally, and was rebuffed by some fictitious Judge, and then did it anyway. It is difficult to tell which leader is more dangerous, at least to me.

It is better to take out the North Korean military and its leadership now rather than later.  Easy to say, difficult to do.  Maybe removing the leadership would be enough.  It may be possible to kill Kim and those around him, but if the North attacks the South it will result lots of lost lives and the unification of Korea. Is the South willing to take these steps or will they take their chances on the future of a North Koreas with missile capable nuclear weapons?

Maybe it would be worthwhile revisiting the question of why North Korea is so defensive about joining the world community as an ally rather than an enemy? I have lost sight of the history of the factors which have lead to the continuance of  North Korea's fears, doubt, insecurities and resulting belligerence.
Civil War.  It never ended.  Just like with Mainland China and Taiwan.  When you fight your brother and it doesn't officially - tension will remain.

Obama ultimately pressed the Pentagon and intelligence agencies to pull out all the stops, which officials took as encouragement to reach for untested technologies.

The North’s missiles soon began to fail at a remarkable pace

In 1994 President Clinton reached an agreement with North Korea that reduced the risks of nuclear weapons. Bush/Cheney decided to disavow the agreement and North Korea then escalated and we've been in this horrible cycle ever since. We continue to pay a heavy price for those years...
Revisionist history, Bush did not disavow the Clinton framework until North Korea Detonated a nuclear device in 2006.

Sounds like a great plan, Steve. One teeny-tiny little snag could be convincing the North Korean government to surrender its power. However, their past behavior has shown them to be a sane and responsible group of folks, so I am sure they will give up with no questions asked.

Who needs missiles or planes to deliver nuclear weapons?  With ton loads of drugs, people, and merchandise smuggled across boarders around the world almost as easily as driving across town, its naïve to think that such devices aren't already buried here, there and everywhere.

Keep in mind Korea is the second exisitineal crisis. The earth is also at a tipping point; that is unless they solve climate change now; we will be flooded out of existence. Now is the time to put partisan politics aside ask honestly if this leadership can succeed. The answer is they are rolling back climate protection measures. And Trump has expressed praise for Kim Jong Un; "it's incredible how he dispatched his political opponents". And "you've got to give him credit".

I wouldn't want to be in South Korea. With or without North Korean nukes being employed, they will bear the brunt of whatever retaliation the north takes after we attack the missile program more directly. Japan will be next in line. Yes, we have military personnel and many civilians in both places, but their casualties will be in the millions.

While I'm aware that a majority of the information presented in this article is public knowledge, it is this detailed reporting on military capabilities (or weaknesses) of the United States and its allies that gives me pause.

I appreciate the need for transparency in these dark, politically underhanded times; however, this information (e.g. the specific success/failure percentages of missile intercept programs, covert operations being discussed to protect American lives) does not belong in the news unless it's part of a mis-information campaign.

This is one of the very few areas in which I agree with President Trump.

In my humble opinion, it is irresponsible of this fine news agency to print such detailed information which, ultimately, reduces the efficacy of such efforts on the battlefield.

Shaking my head.
NG
I think you can safely assume that this is an intentional warning to NK that we are paying attention and are poised to deal with any actualized threat.

My guess is that this information was purposefully leaked to the press by intelligence and defense agencies as a desperate measure to get the attention of the White House.  As we know, the administration has been generally ignoring/declining intelligence briefings, and has rendered the diplomatic arm of our government (State Dept) impotent.
Agreed. Reading this in a national forum has been enlightening but also, terrifying, given the current administration.

" I'd rather have a check on North Korean missiles heading to the state then the silly wall"

That is like saying, "I would rater have food than shelter". We need both and the projected cost of the wall is under $25 billion, or far less than .1% of the US budget.

As a Californian, you do not WANT the wall. But don't pretend that the wall prevents us from protecting ourselves from North Korea. It would in fact remove one contentious issue - further illegal immigration. Then it would leave us free to ask, "What shall we do with people who are already here?" And "What shall we do about North Korea?"

American citizens need to stand up and demand the government stay focused on problems that are real, and stop inventing bottomless money pit problems of military theory. The North Korean leaders are desperate to stay alive and in power. They'd all die in an hour if they were to drop one missile of any sort on any foreign nation. You can be sure an American sub is parked off their coast practicing 24/7 leveling the place end to end. So stop scaring the American public with ridiculous scenarios that have less likelihood than a meteor strike or supervolcano.

"The whole aim of practical politics is to keep the populace alarmed (and hence clamorous to be led to safety) by menacing it with an endless series of hobgoblins, all of them imaginary." - H. L. Mencken

You do understand that we are talking about a dictator that had his uncle eaten by dogs and hired assassins to kill his half-brother, don't you?
While you may be cowering in the basement from a story such as this, the rest of us take it for what it is; an article discussing the reality of the world we live in.

You seem to be confused, please allow me to clarify.

1. My post indicates I am well aware of the scope of the danger of North Korea. I will add that I can run off a litany of bad acts by history's bad men from Jackson and trail of tears to Stalin's purges to Ariel Sharon's Sabra & Shatila Massacre.
2. My tone and words demonstrate that I dismiss the inflated danger of N. Korea, as such your suggestion I may be cowering indicates you did not read my comment.

The leadership of the United States and South Korea is in a shambles. This leaves a vacuum for North Korea to flourish.

This is an emergency. Playing nice isn't going to work anymore and going only with all of the ways we've been fighting the threat isn't enough.

It is time to remove Kim and those involved in creating this threat to the world.

Looks like the democrats illegally bugged Trump Tower.  If this is true, democrats are going to jail and this would be the biggest scandal since Wategate.  Meanwhile, not an iota of evidence of Trump campaign/Russian contacts .  ZERO..NADA!!   Then there is Pelosi lying about knowing the Russian Ambassador, then we have Schumer partying with the Russians, and then more than 20 visits to the white house.  Democrats have been using the Russians as political ammunition but it looks like they are the ones who need to be investigated.   It was always clear that hatred would drive democrats to break the law and cloud their judgement thinking they would not get caught.

There has been a cancer on this country called the Republican Party. Their party first mentality and their anti democratic values along with their horrid policy prescriptions have brought us to a dark place. The cancer has been exacerbated by Trump. The two feed off one another to the point the patient
is in a death spiral.

Anyone of sound mind and reason knows in their heart of hearts Trump is behind this romance with the Russkies. Trump admires strong men with enormous power and stamina, in his mind, winners. They who rule with iron fists Trump is enamored with. This demagogue who was foisted upon us by the poorly educated gullible goobers of the Republican party have really stuck their collective foot in the Big Muddy this time. Trump will be the bane of their existence. The GOP has been the Stupid Party for so long we've lost track. Trump's ascendancy assures they will be scarred with this moniker for eons.

DD
Manhattan
Hillary released her tax returns. When Donald does the same perhaps we can begin to put this behind us. I'm not betting on it!

Trump's tweets are total tells.  I expect the press to sell me they have Prism metadata and GCHQ netted the Russians getting back to Vlad.  Sadly, the  characterization is going to be Russian. My understanding is Russians think Trump is a loose cannon, and now he might even blow up in their faces.

We may be giving Trump's brain too much credit.

It may be possible that Trump actually thinks of Russia as only a business partner. His ignorance and lack of interest in anything not directly feeding his ego or filling his pockets could well make him oblivious to the real reason all the nefarious Russian contacts are swarming around him, gaining entrance to his inner circle.

The Russians know that they shouldn't be seen with Trump himself. They own him, but they are way too smart to make it look like they do, and Trump is way too ignorant to realize what they are really up to.

"Attorney General Jeff Sessions admitted to having meetings with Mr. Kislyak that he had not disclosed during his confirmation hearing. "  The Attorney General, head of the United States Justice Dept. lied at his hearing. That's what actually happened, so why not report that?

Let's pretend all these discovered and denied Russian contacts and resulting suspicions were swirling around a person named Hillary. Can you imagine the Republicans, with finally a real scandal in front of their faces,  going, No problem, nothing here, let's move on?

Trump is being his typical self in calling this business a total witch hunt. But this time, the witch is all too real and the hunt is absolutely necessary. One good way to pursue the hunt is to bring Trump’s financial records out of the shadows and discover if and where he might be beholden to Russian interests.
Folks seriously under sell that dossier's disturbing stories.  For me it was Carter Page making plans for shares in Russian gas afterward.
Pretty ironic, Republicans accusing someone else of a witch hunt.

The reason so many Trump people forgot about their meetings with the Russians is because they were programmed to believe they were at a meeting of a ladies' garden club.  That's also why they think Donald Trump is "the kindest, bravest, warmest, most wonderful human being I've ever known in my life."
